storyInfo: Bena receives a blank check from Grandmother in the mail, all signed but not a single number filled in. She needs to give Grandmother her reply.

attributes.content: The children have been safekeeping quite the nouveau things as of late.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: A model of Rhodes Island—a camera—
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: And this rather valuable-seeming gold coin.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: You just don't see sweeties and milk teeth as often these days.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: But new things might need to be handled a little differently compared to the old. Will it make any trouble if we don't go by the books, I wonder...?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: When I can, I should drop back in on Grandmother sometime. And ask her if she's got any idea while I'm there.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: What is it, Annie? I'm occupied.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Delivery fairy? Is it time we made good on some Rhodes Island grown-up's childhood wish?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Oh, a child called Bena's... I thought I was familiar with every child aboard, but I don't think any of them were named Bena.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: I certainly don't remember entrusting any safekeepings to Granny.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: I just told you I didn't.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Harrumph... Let me take a look, then.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: What have we here... a letter?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Seemingly not... all these boxes... and Grandmother's signature.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: You make a wish with it.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Fill in a number, and you get money.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Sounds like the sort of thing grown-ups would be fond of.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: But what's Grandmother sent me this for?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: She must've found that fruit pit I hid under her pillow last time I went to the Castle!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Oh-hoh-hoh, trust Granny to send this sort of nonsense as a practical joke.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Well, she certainly succeeded with flying colors this time.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: A gold coin... hmm, how did we handle gold coins again...?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Bena, I'm off to fetch the lucky doll.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Yes, yes, be careful out of doors, don't get lost.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Hrmm. What does the manual say—
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: I think that should do it.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Annie, my work is done! Let's go out and play!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Come on, chop-chop while we can! There'll be evening classes soon!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: The silly girl's ditched me to have her own fun again.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Well, after spending so long sat on my bottom, a little exercise is in order.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Let's see where we'll be tagging Annie today.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Hmm... another fork in the road.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Time I asked Sir Barkel—mm, actually, let's shake it up for today.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Bena, Bena, oh lost Miss Prim♪ Where to go? Just listen to ♪ her ♪
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Here comes Dame Ingres♪ The way she'll confer♪
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: I just knew you'd be here. Have you been filching toys from Kirara's again?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: The nerve of sneaking out to play here without telling me... hmm?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Well, well... a child's doll? Whose is it?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: I don't know. It was in the playmate pile.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: It does seem a little uncanny, I'll say...
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: If you're late, you have to give a presentation to everyone.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Urk... You should be coming to class with me! That way we'd have a trick for any nag.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: The teacher tonight has a sense of humor, so a quick prank should fly. It won't be totally boring.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: I'll be off, then. Remember to return soon; I want to see you waiting in our room tonight.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Hmm... what was the way to evening class again...?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Can I make her remember this?
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: She promised Granny. She needs to remember.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Huff... Well, today's class was interesting.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: The teacher asked us what wishes we have, and the things started pouring out of everyone's mouths. Then we all wrote them down onto letters and handed them to the teacher, who arranged that we could come and fetch them in ten years' time.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: My, my, that's our job to the T.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: I collected plenty of articles as we went along, so Grandmother's sure to be pleased.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: What? If Iris were attending that class, she'd have done the same thing.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: I just saw a move or two ahead, you see? Haha!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Mmf. Still, as voluntary as it is... I can't argue taking classes in the evening is a little...
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: No thank you. I'm no child, you know.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: I... I feel so sorry for her...
attributes.name: Mummy

attributes.content: We can only hope to keep the malady from reaching her too...
attributes.name: Daddy

attributes.content: We'll be in Victoria soon, and then...
attributes.name: Daddy

attributes.content: ■■, Daddy and Mummy are going to buy some food from a shop over there. Just sit here and rest yourself for now.
attributes.name: Daddy

attributes.content: I don't want it. I just want Mummy and Daddy to stay.
I just want... just want to be with Mummy and Daddy...
You're all the family I have...
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: And I thought we were clear we didn't have anything to do with each other.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Mgh... Iris does make delicious tarts.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Be honest. Where did you learn all that babying talk?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Isn't she more fond of those action games?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: I'll have to take a peek at her collection next time.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: For now, let's get some sleep. Proper sleep.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Remember to give Grandmother your reply tomorrow.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Rock-a-bye~♪ Rock-a-bye~♪ There's a moon round and bright~♪
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Are we going out to play?
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: I found the lucky doll for us.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Pink, with two little knives, stitches and patches all over, who you can make a wish to if you happen to meet? And then your next few days are awfully lucky, was it?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Sounds like the perfect wool to pull over children's eyes.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: And you don't suppose the doll has a Castle of Dreams-type place trailing it about, too...
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: So you found it yesterday. Has your wish come true?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Has it, or has it not?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Oh, don't learn to keep mum as well, Annie, that won't do!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: *sigh* Come on, we're going to find that doll together.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: But from what I heard, it was awfully hard to find it. Sometimes it even runs away when it's seen. Do you really think you can fetch it again?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Hmph... So you've started making friends behind my back to boot. Naughty.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Erm... why are we here again?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: What a mountainous pile of playmates.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Let me see where that little rapscallion is hidden.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Nor this one, I don't think.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Hum. So there are sound-making dolls nowadays?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Err... the color's right, but it hasn't any knives, and it's not shabby, so I wouldn't think so...
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: There's a hint of evil about it...
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: What exquisite needlework. And sewn with some marvelous cloth, too.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Its owner must care for it very much.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Morte says you can make your wish.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: A wish... Ooh, let me think.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Get out of my sight and never come back!
attributes.name: Slum Dweller

attributes.content: Let this be your home from now on, little lamb.
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: Hello, I'm Iris. We'll be friends from now on.
attributes.name: Iris

attributes.content: There's oodles of toys in the playroom, and plenty of people to play with them together, so what's the harm in staying a little longer?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: (Ah, I remember her. Shamare, I think? Hilariously difficult to get along with.)
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: (Last time I asked if she wanted to safekeep anything, she put a curse on me!)
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: (Because you kept pestering her. It was very annoying.)
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: It's Morte. I can only patch it up. It'll always fall apart.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: Alright, alright, I'll go and do it.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Shamare, preparing your symbols and doing this patchwork must be a terrible burden.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: I can handle the patchwork half for you. Think of it as thanks for the apple.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Then you take Morte. I'll draw my symbols.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: Good, a complete set of tools. Looks like it gets damaged quite often.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Does needlework like this hurt it?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Hmm... I'm fairly sure it does. I can feel it.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: But that's alright. I'm still here.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Next time, could you just ask Kirara to lend me that adventure game for a few days?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Look at you. Your mouth is covered in honey.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: *sigh* Let's get started. I'd feel bad about eating her apples before I finish darning, after all.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: It says you sewed it very well.
attributes.name: Shamare

attributes.content: No, no, it's nothing. I'm a dab hand when it comes to handiwork, you know.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: I still get that uncanny feeling...
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: *sigh* Who knew wishes could come real so fast?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: I'm surprised she likes her apples this sweet. You'd never guess from how unapproachable she is.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Bena, no judging books by their covers.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Let's sit here a little while longer, and then we're off to Rhodes Island for a grand adventure, okay?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: But before that, there's something you need to do, Bena.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: That's the... check, that... Grandmother sent me.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Are pranks the sort of thing you reply to, now...?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: I forgot to ask. Little lamb, what's your name?
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: I—I don't know... they call me things like little wretch, or bastard girl, or Caprinae imp...
Those aren't names. Forget about those.
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: From now on, if anyone dares bully you again, use the Arts and the self-defense Granny's taught you to sort them out.
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: But, Granny, you haven't... taught me yet...
Ho-ho-ho, all in due time, little lamb, all in due time. Granny will teach you everything.
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: For now, let's give you a name.
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: Hm... how about... we call you 'Bena'?
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: Be... na. Bena. It sounds pretty. And... rings a bell.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: There was once a pair of dearly close children who were soon to part, who entrusted to Granny a letter to safekeep.
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: Should they be wed, their letter would be returned to them on the day their child was born, care of the Castle of Dreams.
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: It was the most complicated request I'd taken in a long while.
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: So, did they marry each other?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: They did, little lamb, and they gave birth to an adorable little girl, and on that letter was written this girl's name.
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: But—they wouldn't know how many children they were going to have. What if they were twins?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: There were a great many names on that letter, little lamb.
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: So if—if they had a second girl, what would she be named?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: You see, little lamb? This is the work Granny does.
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: Someone has to be watching. Someone has to make good.
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: But Granny's old, now, and can't keep up with it anymore.
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: Little lamb, would you like to learn? To take on a little of Granny's work for her?
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: Of course, Granny. Am I learning to post letters?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: No, little lamb, that you needn't learn.
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: 'The art of safekeeping'. That's what I'd like you to learn.
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: To preserve an item untouched, unchanging over decades and centuries, to be returned to one's hands just the same as when it had left.
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: Would you like to learn it?
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: Then allow me to commence the first lesson.
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: Everything, with no exception, has to begin from a wish.
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: Come make a wish, little lamb. Preserve a thing for future you.
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: What would you like to leave, to your future self?
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: I want money. Lots and lots of money.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Then I can search for my mummy and daddy, and I can have an even nicer life.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: A fine wish, little lamb. Truly, a fine one.
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: Granny will gladly fulfill this wish of yours.
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: But Granny would like to wager with you, too.
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: To wager whether, on the day you get it, you'll wish it was something different, something even more precious.
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: What's more precious than lots and lots of money?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: When the day comes, hmm... how long away do you want it?
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: Five years from now, the moment it reaches you, you write on it however much money it is you want, then take it to a bank, and the money will be yours.
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: I'll be looking forward to your answer.
attributes.name: Grandmother

attributes.content: Ah! You did this, didn't you!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Annie's done a lot of things.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: That funny lucky doll business with Morte, that was you!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Shamare's trying hard to turn her curses into blessings.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Annie borrowed it for a bit.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: So you wished to have me remember to reply to Grandmother?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Yes. But it didn't work very well.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Mnnn... never mind. It didn't matter too much anyhow. I forgive you.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Now, let's put our heads together and think up our response to Granny.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: How much money do you want, Bena?
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Even if we were able to buy up all of Rhodes Island, or the entire Castle of Dreams, or the whole of Victoria, I feel like what's bound to happen would happen anyway. Especially the bad things.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Seeing as I thought it was a prank in the first place, we'll prank her right back!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Now get some apple juice. I hear apple juice can write invisible letters. This way, I can really play a joke on Granny.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: I just squeezed some from the leftover core.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Hmm... what do we write in this box, now?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Eat apples... smile everyday... fool about...
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Post it back? This is the most marvelous practical joke ever. How could we post it back?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: Iris was wanting to go back and see Granny soon, wasn't she?
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: And I'll hand it back to Granny in person, and see how she reacts. That'll be interesting.
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: You'll have to pretend you completely forgot about it, too.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Grandmother will be sure to furrow her brows.
attributes.name: Annie

attributes.content: Oh, you're right! Now THAT'S a worthy spectacle!
attributes.name: Bena

attributes.content: I'm already dying to see the confusion on her face!
attributes.name: Bena
